Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that adults who test positive for COVID-19 will not be separated from their children and placed in temporary foster care.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the consequences by stating that children in households with COVID-19 positive parents will be placed in temporary foster care until their parents/guardians recover.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement in the claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a fake letter that circulated online.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that receiving state assistance benefits is conditional upon getting tested for COVID-19, which is not true.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no evidence of alternative explanations in the claim.
